availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Yeveston O. Booker (Greensburg hotel keeper and farmer)

body.p: Greensburg hotel keeper and farmer. Virginia native. Married Jane Booker. Father of David E. Booker, Matilda C. Booker, and Waller T. Booker. Held eleven slaves in 1860.

bibl.p: KYR-0001-004-1972. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 123. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 209. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, District 2, p. 84. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 17. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, Precinct 1, p. 12.
